title: Keypair syncing - edge cases

milestone.description:
**Main focus:**

**1. Ability for user to select & manage accounts shared with each community control node**
- This item is quite a bit of work
- Includes Community settings, as well as community join flows

**2. Updates to control node transfer dialogues**
- Remove ability for a Owner to leave a community on the computer that's running as that community's control node
- Community Admin home screen cleanup

**3. finish anything that wasn't completed in 0.13**
- Make sure all Community token functionality *is very well tested*, fix any issues found
- Ensure accounts stored on Keycard are taken into consideration for community permissions

**4. Final screens and bits and bobs needed prior to public beta**
- Modal that's shown every time after login, reminding user's that Status Desktop is in Beta
- Community Admin home screen cleanup + add graphs
- Test a community that contains 10,000 members, fix whatever needs fixing.  Member bar perhaps?

**5. fix bugs everywhere, perf improvements**

**6. QR scanner**
- Needed for private key transfer
- Ethereum key QRs (send modal triggered)
- User Share URL in a QR (opens user profile dialogue) 
- Community and Channel inside Community URL in QRs (takes user to Community or Channel in Community)

**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Finish any outstanding work related to Activity screens

2. Updated Wallet Settings screens inc. account syncing functionality

3. Fix bugs, clean up loose ends (to get things in a good state before the work on the Mobile wallet starts)

4. Total balance graphs for 'All accounts' and each individual account

5. Advanced transaction signing

body:
More less keypairs+keycards and watch-only accounts syncing is introduced in this PR https://github.com/status-im/status-go/pull/3475, but that is good if on both sides data refers to regular account. The whole point here is about ecryption and keystore files. In the table below `regular profile` refers to a profile keypair which is not migrated to a Keycard, `keycard profile` refers to a profile keypair which is migrated to a Keycard. | device A | recover from another device B (local pairing) | Expected state | | -- | -- | -- | | regular profile | regular profile | on device A must be:
-the same keypairs/accounts as on device B;
- the same set of keystore files as on device B;
- keystore files and db encrypted using password; | | regular profile | keycard profile | on device A must be:
-the same keypairs/accounts as on device B;
- the same set of non profile keypair related keystore files as on device B;
- keystore files and db encrypted using encryption public key; | | keycard profile | regular profile | N/A | | keycard profile | keycard profile | N/A | | device A | recover from Waku | Expected state | | -- | -- | -- | | regular profile | regular profile | on device A must be:
- the same keypairs/accounts as it was at the moment when last backup was performed;
- no other keystore files then those referring to Status account + one for the default wallet account (path m/44'/60'/0'/0/0);
- no keystore files created for any of received seed/privatekey keypairs;
- keystore files and db encrypted using password; | | regular profile | keycard profile | on device A must be:
- the same keypairs/accounts as it was at the moment when last backup was performed;
- no keystore files;
- keystore files and db encrypted using encryption public key; | | keycard profile | regular profile | N/A | | keycard profile | keycard profile | N/A | | device A | local pairing with device B (not recovering) | Expected state | | -- | -- | -- | | regular profile | regular profile | on device A must be:
-the same keypairs/accounts as on device B (means accounts stored on device A which are different then those stored on device B will be removed);
- the same set of keystore files as on device B;
- keystore files and db encrypted using password; | | regular profile | keycard profile | first we need to warn user that he is syncing with the device where profile keypair is migrated to a keycard;
if he confirms syncing then on device A must be:
- the same keypairs/accounts as on device B (means accounts stored on device A which are different then those stored on device B will be removed);
- the same set of keystore files as on device B;
- keystore files and db encrypted using encryption public key; | | keycard profile | regular profile | first we need to warn user that he is syncing with the device where profile keypair is not migrated to a keycard;
if he confirms syncing then on device A must be:
- the same keypairs/accounts as on device B (means accounts stored on device A which are different then those stored on device B will be removed);
- the same set of keystore files as on device B;
- keystore files and db encrypted using password; | | keycard profile | keycard profile | on device A must be:
-the same keypairs/accounts as on device B (means accounts stored on device A which are different then those stored on device B will be removed);
- the same set of keystore files as on device B;
- keystore files and db encrypted using encryption public key; | | device A | migrating account on device B if A and B are already paired | Expected state | | -- | -- | -- | | regular profile | migrating to regular profile | N/A | | regular profile | migrating to keycard profile | on device A must be:
- the same set of keystore files as on device B (means profile keypair related keystore files are removed);
- keystore files and db encrypted using encryption public key; | | keycard profile | migrating to regular profile | on device A must be:
- no keystore files created for any account related to a profile keypair;
- keystore files and db encrypted using password;| | keycard profile | migrating to keycard profile | N/A |
